dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So a 49-year lease for a new U.S. consulate in Almaty—what does that say about America's long-term strategy in Central Asia?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So a forty nine-year lease for a new U.S. consulate in Almaty-what does that say about America's long-term strategy in Central Asia?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Under the agreement, the United States will lease a plot of land in Almaty measuring approximately seven hectares (70,593 square meters) for a period of 49 years to build a new consulate compound.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's a huge commitment, right? Seven hectares of land, that's not small. And they're paying over $25 million just for the lease.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's a huge commitment, right? Seven hectares of land, that's not small. And they're paying over twenty five dollars million just for the lease.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Under the agreement, the United States will lease a plot of land in Almaty measuring approximately seven hectares (70,593 square meters) for a period of 49 years to build a new consulate compound. The U.S. will pay $25.3 million as a one-time payment within 30 days of the agreement's entry into force.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's a one-time payment too, which is interesting. Plus, Kazakhstan is waiving all taxes and customs duties on this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's a one-time payment too, which is interesting. Plus, Kazakhstan is waiving all taxes and customs duties on this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. will pay $25.3 million as a one-time payment within 30 days of the agreement's entry into force. According to the terms, the U.S. will be exempt from taxes and customs duties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's a pretty sweet deal for the U.S., honestly. But I guess Kazakhstan sees benefits too—like boosting their international image and attracting investment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a pretty sweet deal for the U.S., honestly. But I guess Kazakhstan sees benefits too-like boosting their international image and attracting investment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is projected to enhance Kazakhstan's international image, attract investment, create jobs, and support the development of local business and service sectors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and it's supposed to become the largest U.S. visa center in the region. That could really streamline things for travelers and businesses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and it's supposed to become the largest U.S. visa center in the region. That could really streamline things for travelers and businesses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lawmakers note that the new consulate is expected to become the largest U.S. visa center in Central Asia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just the consulate—they're also housing the DEA and Commerce Department offices there. So it's like a mini diplomatic hub.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just the consulate-they're also housing the D E A and Commerce Department offices there. So it's like a mini diplomatic hub.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to the consulate, the site will also house offices of the U.S. Department of Commerce, the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), and the U.S. Commercial Service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and First Deputy Foreign Minister Akan Rakhmetullin mentioned they're currently renting two private buildings, so consolidating into one purpose-built facility makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and First Deputy Foreign Minister Akan Rakhmetullin mentioned they're currently renting two private buildings, so consolidating into one purpose-built facility makes sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to First Deputy Foreign Minister Akan Rakhmetullin, once the new building is complete, the current U.S. consulate staff in Almaty will relocate there. They are currently renting two buildings in Almaty privately.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Though he was a bit vague on whether they'll actually expand the staff. Like, he said it's possible but not certain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Though he was a bit vague on whether they'll actually expand the staff. Like, he said it's possible but not certain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As for expanding the staff, I don't have exact information. But since it will be a full-fledged facility with all the infrastructure, some expansion is likely"though not certain"as it will depend on further discussions with the U.S. side, Rakhmetullin said on the sidelines of the Senate session.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, depends on further talks with the U.S. side. But once construction starts—apparently by an American developer—it'll be a big project.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, depends on further talks with the U.S. side. But once construction starts-apparently by an American developer-it'll be a big project.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After the President signs the agreement, the Almaty akimat (city administration) and the U.S. consulate will sign an additional accord to begin construction, which will be carried out by an American developer, Rakhmetullin added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Tengrinews.kz even called it the most expensive land plot in Almaty. So location matters, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the website even called it the most expensive land plot in Almaty. So location matters, I guess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, a Tengrinews.kz correspondent visited the plot of land in Almaty. US leases the most expensive land plot in Almaty

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. This feels like a strategic move to deepen ties, not just a bureaucratic upgrade.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. This feels like a strategic move to deepen ties, not just a bureaucratic upgrade.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Strengthening U.S.-Kazakhstan relations—that's the bigger picture here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Strengthening U.S.-Kazakhstan relations-that's the bigger picture here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is expected to boost trust among international partners and strengthen U.S.-Kazakhstan relations.
